verses.text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
verses.comment: Begins genealogies; see Genesis 5:1–6 for parallel.

verses.text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
verses.comment: Names are consistent with Genesis 5:9–15.

verses.text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
verses.comment: Same genealogy as Genesis 5.

verses.text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.comment: List of Noah’s sons, also see Gen. 5:32.

verses.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
verses.comment: Listing sons of Japheth, cf. Gen. 10:2.

verses.text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
verses.comment: Gen. 10:3 has 'Riphath,' possible alternate spelling as 'Diphath' here.

verses.text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
verses.comment: Rodanim is sometimes Dodanim in Gen. 10:4; kept as in 1 Chron.

verses.text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt, Put, and Canaan.
verses.comment: Egypt is 'Mizraim' in Hebrew; rendered as 'Egypt' for clarity.

verses.text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
verses.comment: Matches Gen. 10:7.

verses.text: Cush fathered Nimrod; he was the first on earth to be a mighty man.
verses.comment: Follows Gen. 10:8–9; 'mighty man' is literally 'strong one.'

verses.text: Egypt fathered Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
verses.comment: Gen. 10:13; Ludim and following are tribal names.

verses.text: Pathrusim, Casluhim (from whom the Philistines came), and Caphtorim.
verses.comment: Parenthetical about Philistines is retained from the Hebrew.

verses.text: Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
verses.comment: Listing sons of Canaan.

verses.text: the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite,
verses.comment: Tribal groups; cf. Gen. 10:16.

verses.text: the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite,
verses.comment: Continued from previous verse.

verses.text: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
verses.comment: Completing the list from Genesis.

verses.text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
verses.comment: Meshech appears here; in Gen. 10:23, 'Mash' is used, reflecting a manuscript difference.

verses.text: Arphaxad fathered Shelah, and Shelah fathered Eber.
verses.comment: Eber is the ancestor of the Hebrews.

verses.text: To Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided, and his brother's name was Joktan.
verses.comment: 'Peleg' means division; retains the reason for the name.

verses.text: Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.comment: Follows the list from Genesis 10.

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.comment: Obal is sometimes spelled 'Ebal' in manuscripts.

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.
Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
verses.comment: Transitioning to the Shem line.

verses.text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
Serug, Nahor, Terah,
Abram, that is, Abraham.
verses.comment: ‘Abram’ is clarified as ‘Abraham’ here, cf. Gen. 17:5.

verses.text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
These are their descendants: the firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
verses.comment: Cf. Gen. 25:13 for this genealogy.

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
verses.comment: Hadad is spelled as 'Hadad' here, though some manuscripts have 'Hadar.'

verses.text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
verses.comment: Keturah is called Abraham's concubine (cf. Gen. 25:1).

verses.text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the descendants of Keturah.
Abraham fathered Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
verses.comment: ‘Israel’ is used for Jacob.

verses.text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz, and Amalek.
verses.comment: Some manuscripts list Amalek as offspring of Eliphaz's concubine; included for completeness.

verses.text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
verses.comment: Seir the Horite, cf. Gen. 36:20.

verses.text: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam; and Lotan's sister was Timna.
The sons of Shobal: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
verses.comment: 'Alian' is 'Alvan' in some manuscripts; 'Shephi' is also 'Shepho.'

verses.text: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
verses.comment: 'Hamran' is sometimes 'Hemdan.'

verses.text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
verses.comment: 'Jaakan' is 'Akan' in some texts.

verses.text: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king ruled over the Israelites: Bela the son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah.
verses.comment: Introduces Edomite kingship before Israelite monarchy.

verses.text: When Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah from Bozrah became king in his place.
When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites became king in his place.
When Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the territory of Moab, became king in his place. The name of his city was Avith.
When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah became king in his place.
When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river became king in his place.
When Shaul died, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor became king in his place.
When Baal-hanan died, Hadad became king in his place. His city was named Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, daughter of Matred, daughter of Mezahab.
verses.comment: 'Pai' is 'Pau' in some manuscripts.

verses.text: Then Hadad died. The chiefs of Edom were: Chief Timna, Chief Aliah, Chief Jetheth,
verses.comment: 'Aliah' is 'Alvah' in other texts.

verses.text: Chief Oholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon,
Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar,
Chief Magdiel, and Chief Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
verses.comment: Concludes with a list of the Edomite chiefs.
